À : 'nebaird.sail@gmail.com' <nebaird.sail@gmail.com>
Objet : Your 2025 Wedding at Château Canet

 

Dear Nicholas;

Congratulations on your engagement, and thank you for your enquiry and interest in celebrating your wedding at Château Canet. 

We are fully booked on May 17th, 2025, but we do have more availability earlier in May and in June as well. Are your dates flexible?  

Château Canet offers you the opportunity to celebrate your wedding the way you want. We offer a minimum of 3 nights stay, allowing you the time to celebrate more than just your wedding. Our venue nestled between vineyards and olive groves is the perfect place for you to enjoy your nearest and dearest and create memories that will stay with you for a lifetime.

Below is an overview of what is included in our exclusive rental and the information attached information will give you more details as well as an idea of weddings we have hosted and the kind of atmosphere you can create.

Accommodation for 39 guests in 9 cottages with the possibility of an additional 9 beds. Guests can enjoy the heated swimming pool, tennis & boules courts. We can organise transport for other guests, there are local B&B’s and Carcassonne, 15 minutes away has a large choice of accommodation.

Breakfast included for guests staying on site.

Choice of venues. You can design your wedding around the different indoor and outdoor venues and surprise your guests at every occasion.  Do note, there is no curfew! 

*The interior of the Château is private, but the lawn can be used for either the reception or the ceremony. We are limited to 80 guests for indoor seating (Orangerie reception hall).

Flexible Catering. You can enjoy anything from a gourmet French dinner, a food truck, to more informal BBQ or vineyard picnic.  

Domaine wine at cellar door prices.  We offer a range of red, white, rosé & sparkling wines from 7€ to 25€ per bottle.  You only pay for what is consumed.

Suppliers list. We share our list of trusted contacts such as photographer, florist, musicians, celebrants, hairdresser, make up, transport etc.

Pre wedding weekend allowing you to get familiar with the property and to meet your suppliers.

Unique wine activities. Take advantage of staying on a wine estate and offer your guests a cellar tour,  interactive wine tasting or blend your own wedding wine.

Wedding coordination and planning support. This includes three meetings to discuss and share our experience on how best to plan your wedding weekend. We can help you with the ambiance, style and overall experience you are looking to create.  We also help you plan your timeline and provide valuable behind the scenes support to ensure that everything runs just the way you want.  

On site hosting from the moment you arrive with a friendly face you can call on.

The exclusive rental price in 2025 is 18.000€ including 3 nights’ accommodation for 39 guest and your planning & coordination support.

I trust this gives you a good sense of what we offer and if you are interested I would of course be delighted to set up a call or virtual tour. 

We look forward to hearing back from you; 

Best regards

Anna

Subject: Fwd: 2 day sprint proposal
Body:
Nic ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Nicholas Baird Date: Sat, Mar 16, 2024 at 12:07 PM Subject: Re: 2 day sprint proposal To: Patrick Lung , , < andrewnguonly@gmail.com>, , , Charlie Liang Yuan , Matt Hoffman Hey folks, Received some feedback and going to make a slight change of plans. We *will *do two Monday sessions to trade notes and brainstorm as a group all together, but most will stop there. Depending on interest a smaller group might scope out and build something Monday evening and Tuesday, but will depend on how the meetings go in the am. Everything else will stay the same, but I'll put some events on the calendar. Hard to organize the right time for this many people so just make what you can unless there's a big blocker then reach out to me and I'll see what I can do. *Monday schedule:* - 9am - 10:30am: Note sharing session. We might not need this much time, but lots of ideas I want folks to share - will spend 20-30 min reading any materials folks have to share, then discuss - 11 - 1: Brainstorming session. Again, might be too long but we can stop whenever, just want to hold the time. - We'll do sticky note meeting, so bring some ideas to answer the following question: - *What’s the right way to gather user intent data that’s unique & monetizable?* - I know this is a little off topic for some, but I think it's ultimately relevant for what we're all working on to make each product sufficiently differentiated. We have 5 people committed to the morning meetings, and we'll see where it goes from there. Looking forward to it! For now, *please reply all with any relevant pre-reads. *This means stuff you've written to explain the idea space you're exploring. Make it short, summaries of what you've learned. Here's mine: https://sumptuous-slope-b3d.notion.site/Consumer-Journey-Tool-Layering-980e6be916dd49c69ea57945ee893233?pvs=74 See you all on Monday, Nic On Wed, Mar 13, 2024 at 11:40 PM Nicholas Baird wrote: > Hey all, > > I just shared out this > > notion > > doc which outlines a sprint I'm proposing for two days next week. Most of > you know about this already but if not, would be great to have you. Feel > free to make comments in the doc and propose different structure etc. The > point of this is to get those of us working on similar projects to get > together and share notes & ideas, and maybe even build something nascent if > we feel compelled. > > Want to be clear that this is opt-in, I'm not forcing you to join! I've > heard from at least half of you that you're in already, but please lmk your > interest. > > Otherwise, looking forward to jamming on the doc & next week, > Nic > > >

Nic

On Fri, Mar 15, 2024, 11:37 AM Alyse Rosenblatt <alyse@frankdarling.com> wrote:
Hi Nicholas,

I hope all is well! Our QA team looked at your ring, and after reviewing it, we think it's best to remake it to accommodate tightening the prongs as well as resizing to a size 6!

The new ring would be covered under our manufacturer's warranty and take about four weeks to make — one week to update the CAD model, and three weeks to remake the ring once the CAD model has been updated.

If you can also confirm the following details, that would be great:

Original PO Number: 21326
Metal: 14k yellow gold
Ring size: updating to a size 6 and removing speed bumps
Any engraving or birthstone details to maintain: n/a
Band thickness: 1.8mm
Setting: The Plunge

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns!

Thanks!

Alyse Rosenblatt, Lifetime Care Specialist


 

frankdarling.com  |  646.859.0718 x732

50 Hudson St, Floor 3, New York, NY 10013


My work week is Monday-Friday 9-5pm EST. 
For urgent inquiries, please email hello@frankdarling.com

Subject: More stuff
Body:
Thanks for coming by today, great to walk & do some riffing. You can check out something I spun up in Streamlit for a weekend project with two static datasets. Illustrates the "vibe" input experience I was talking about. I've also done some writing about the high consideration product space. Would be curious for your feedback on that subject. So you've got 4 weeks left at W&B, what are you planning to do in that time & immediately afterwards? I'd love to help out how I can once I know how you're thinking about things & know where I can be useful. Might put together a little consumer *building* group if you're interested. Just hack on a few ideas just to see what it might look like & then shop it around / gather some feedback. All fun stuff, Nic
